pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8ac492e2-4cce-48ff-bbc3-3b8792c6ac43) for commit 49c97d051b75cbff03efa32be2a428e84090b6e0.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c7ccba56-4fe6-4332-81ae-69c25222fb7c/to/8ac492e2-4cce-48ff-bbc3-3b8792c6ac43) against commit b00b6e0fb5ff8f20feb23194be8880e6bedffda1:
```diff
  Benchmark   Metric    Change
  ============================
+ build       linting    -6.0%
```

Pull request successfully merged into master.

This looks good to me with @grunweg's comments. Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks for the clean-up! I have three minor comments/questions, but no blocking objections. Let's have another pair of eyes.
maintainer merge

This looks good to me with @grunweg's comments. Thanks!

bors d+
Let me flag these explicitly, for another reviewer to look at. This seems plausible to me, but I am not fully sure if there are repercussions I am not aware of.
They look good to me. I don't see any likely issues with looping assumptions or problematic matching. We've had them for almost a year so I don't think it's dangerous.
Note that `instance : Trans` is the Lean 4 equivalent of the `@[trans]` attribute.
Alternatively, `by simpa only [le_principal_iff, mem_map]`? Not sure which one is better.
I prefer using `simpa` if it's possible.
Just flagging this for other reviewers: you're deleting this porting note, since the previous proof was not actually nicer, right?
Yeah, I don't think it's desirable to change this back
Should these renames come with a `@[deprecated] alias`?

My understanding is that explicit instance names do not get deprecation aliases. (That said: if you feel there should be consensus on it, feel free to further the zulip thread on a deprecation policy. I intend to return it it, but not in before three weeks.)
